title: TOUCHDOWN PCR
original description: This is the protocol for the touchdown PCR assay

5. 72 oC                                2 min

10. 94 oC                                1 min

14. 72 oC 7 min
15. 15 oC FOREVER
16. End Adapted from: Don RH, Cox PT, Wainwright BJ, Baker K, Mattick JS. “Touchdown” PCR to circumvent spurious priming during gene amplification. Nucleic Acids Res. 1991;19: 4008. doi:10.1093/nar/19.14.4008
ai_generated_description: The touchdown PCR protocol aims to enhance the specificity of PCR amplification by reducing spurious priming. It achieves this by gradually decreasing the annealing temperature during the initial cycles of PCR, allowing only the target DNA to be amplified while minimizing non-specific amplification.
